newsitem.title: USA: Oracle, Netscape to merge Navio/NCI units.
newsitem.headline: Oracle, Netscape to merge Navio/NCI units.

text.p: Oracle Corp and Netscape Communications Corp said Monday they signed a definitive agreement to merge their affiliates, Netscape's Navio Communications and Oracle's Network Computer Inc (NCI).
The new company, NCI, will develop Internet access software for open standards-based network computers and other Internet appliances, the companies said.
Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed. Oracle and NCI will retain majority ownership in the new entity and account for the deal as a purchase transaction.
Netscape will have an equity interest in the new company.
"The merger of NCI and Navio represents a significant milestone for the computer industry," said Jerry Baker, NCI'S chief executive.

"Together we'll continue to work with all our alliance members to develop open standards-based technology for network computing. Our combined efforts will accelerate the adoption of network computers in the consumer, corporate and education markets and make the power of the Internet available to everyone," he said.

Baker will remain chief executive while Wei Yen, the current president and chief executive of Navio, will be president of NCI. Jim Barksdale, Netscape's president and chief executive, and Oracle's chairman and chief executive, Larry Ellison, will serve on the NCI board.
According to the pact, the companies will join under the NCI banner in a new facility based in San Francisco's Bay area.
